item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the restitution of or compensation for property seized during the Nazi and Communist eras.

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 527.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.name: War crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity

summary.text:
Recognizes the unmet needs of many Holocaust survivors and the urgency of addressing those needs.

Expresses appreciation for the efforts of the European countries that have implemented legislation for the restitution of, or compensation for, private, communal, and religious property confiscated during the Nazi or Communist eras, and welcomes the efforts of the governments of many post-Communist countries to address the status of such property.

Urges each government that has not already done so to implement legislation to effect the in rem return of, or the payment of, compensation for such confiscated property.

Calls on the Secretary of State to issue an updated report on property restitution in Central and Eastern Europe.

bill.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the restitution of or compensation for property seized during the Nazi and Communist eras.

item.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the restitution of or compensation for property seized during the Nazi and Communist eras.
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the restitution of or compensation for property seized during the Nazi and Communist eras.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
